content.description:
A tough little thing! Start on the far left end of the downhill facing, overhanging boulder. Stand-start on a side-pull lefthand on the left side of the boulder's face and a righthand on the top sloper on the front lip of the boulder.

 Commence a grueling series of moves linking into a lower rail, shifting into a toehook. Follow the front end of the boulder up and right to the knobby top out.
content.location: Start on the far left end of the downhill facing, overhanging boulder.   Stand-start on a side-pull lefthand on the left side of the boulders face and a righthand on the top sloper on the front lip of the boulder. get a high heelhook-left handfoot match and let your right foot swing underneath the boulder.

content.description: The highest boulder in the Left Boneyard and not really worth visiting. Directly above the Balanced Block and diagonally to the right from the Fish Tank and Bowl Boulder and Block. This boulder has several possible problems but all are fairly lowball. the majority of this boulder is a low large roof, and all of the climbing involves the outer lip of the boulder.
